Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 11:38PM - edited Dec 30, 2010 11:44PM by bcfighter  I was diagnosed at 36 and started treatment in February. Because my tumor was 5cm they decided to do chemo first to shrink it. I was on Carboplatin,Taxotere and Herceptin. My SE was not as bad as expected but I did get tired and a little nausea. Also by the 5th day my taste buds were screwed. I am still on Herceptin till February and am taking Tamoxifen. I started Tamoxifen in July and have a few side effects. I get headaches and my legs hurt like I walked all day. I didnt have a period when I started chemo but did finally get one in October and have gotten one monthy since. I hope everything goes smoothly for her. Take it one day at a time.
Posts.Title: ER+,PR+, HER@+++Prememo Gals motherofpatient bcfighter

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2010 03:06AM bcfighter wrote: Hi Sannie, Sorry to hear about diagnosis.I am also doing chemo before surgery then radiation.I have a total of six treatments to do and have done three so far. I have my fourth one this Wednesday.The first two went well with some body ache after my first treatment but the third one was awful and I'm hoping the last three are not that bad. Hopefully yours goes well also....Take care!!
Posts.Title: New here sannie hmh23

Posts.Content: bcfighter wrote: I have recently been diagnosed with BC at age 36. I am currently getting chemo treatments which include taxotere,carboplatin and herceptin. I will be getting a total of 6 treatments once every 3 weeks. My Dr felt it would be better to do chemo first before surgery to shrink the tumor which is 5cm. So far I have had only one treatment and was wondering if anyone knew how soon after or when would I notice that it was shrinking? Kiana Dx 1/5/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage II, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnosed in January bcfighter Twinmom77

Posts.Content: bcfighter wrote: I was diagnosed with BC and was told I was ER/PR+ HER+. I have had 2 rounds of treatment which included Taxotere,Carbo & Herceptin. I went to my follow up on Monday and was then told that I am HER- after some further testing had been done.. They are now going to put me on AC for 4 treatments followed by 12 weekly treatments of taxol. I was wondering if anyone else with a similar diagnosis was on this same chemo meds? Kiana Dx 1/5/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage II, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
